com.yantra.api.ycp.barcode

Interface translateBarCode

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    YIFApi, com.yantra.api.YSCApi

    public interface translateBarCode

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document translateBarCode(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      translateBarCode API provides an ability to translate various barcodes, which tie back to entities such as items, cartons etc.

    • Method Detail

      • translateBarCode

        org.w3c.dom.Document translateBarCode(YFSEnvironment env,
                                      org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                               throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                      java.rmi.RemoteException

        translateBarCode API provides an ability to translate various barcodes, which tie back to entities such as items, cartons etc. This API provides a means of translating the bar code scanned by bar code scanners before invoking other business APIs that understand items, locations, carton numbers and not their alternate sources of reference.

        • The barcode setup for all bar code types will be maintained at the organization level. Every organization that wishes to use the bar code translation should have the bar code translation setup.
        • A bar code can have a specific length, in which case it is referred to as a fixed length bar code; else the bar code is flagged as a variable length bar code. For fixed length bar codes, user can specify a start and end position for a bar code.
        • Additionally, whether the bar code is fixed length or variable length, the bar code could have an application identifier, which allows selection of a data source based on the nature of the data.
        • Translator source defines how a bar code is validated. In addition to the bar code validation sources supplied by the system, users can associate their own validators by defining appropriate services using service definition framework.
        • External translator should return an XML document that contains the translation results. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        • The software is shipped with the translators for the following Barcode Types:
          • Item
          • ShippingContainer
          • ItemOrShippingContainer
          • ShippingCarton
          • ShippingPallet
          • Batch
          • InventoryContainer
          • InventoryCase
          • InventoryPallet
          • Location
          • LocationOrInventoryContainer
          • LocationBarCode
          • ItemOrInventoryCase
          • ItemTag
          • Shipment
          • ShippingContainerOrShipment
          • NewPrePrintedLicencePlate
          • WorkOrderConfirmation
          • PackInitiation
          • PackSKU
          • SerialScan
          • ManifestContainer
          • PalletBuild
          • PickIntoInventoryCase
          • PickIntoInventoryPallet
          • PackShippingCarton
          • PackShippingPallet
          • ShippingOrInventoryContainer
          • ManualMovePick
          • PICKINITIATION

        • Each of these bar code types has various sources of translators ordered in a sequence. Bar code validation source represents the data to be validated against. Sterling WMS(Sterling Warehouse Management System) provides a default set of Bar Code Sources. They are:

          Source Name Description
          BatchNo BatchNo source validates if scanned data is a valid Batch number in Sterling WMS.
          CartLocation CartLocation source validates if scanned data is a valid Cart location in Sterling WMS. This source expects a valid Batch number as an input. If system finds associated tote or shipment container or shipment with this location, it also returns additional information like shipment container, shipment details.
          CartNo CartNo source validates if scanned data is a valid Cart number in Sterling WMS
          CartonNo CartonNo source validates if scanned data is a valid case number for a shipment in Sterling WMS
          CartonSCM CartonSCM source validates if scanned data is a valid case SCM for a shipment in Sterling WMS
          CaseID CaseID source validates if scanned data is an existing Case SCM in Sterling WMS. If this case contains only single item then it would return item details like Item Id, unit of measure and quantity.
          DummyCaseID DummyCaseID source will always return a successful translation as a valid Case id for the scanned data.
          DummyPalletID DummyPalletID source will always return a successful translation as a valid Pallet id for the scanned data.
          DummySerialTranslator DummySerialTranslator source will return scanned data as a valid serial number if these conditions are met -
          if valid item context information is passed in the input and
          if the item should be a serial tracked item.
          EquipmentId EquipmentId source validates if scanned data is a valid Equipment Id in Sterling WMS.
          ExistingTote ExistingTote source validates if scanned data is an Existing Tote number in Sterling WMS.
          GTIN GTIN source validates if scanned data is a valid Global Trade Identification Number in Sterling WMS. If a valid entry found, it also returns associated information like Item id, unit of measure.
          InboundShipmentCartonSCM InboundShipmentCartonSCM source validates if scanned data is a valid case SCM for an Inbound Shipment in Sterling WMS
          InboundShipmentPalletSCM InboundShipmentPalletSCM source validates if scanned data is a valid Pallet SCM for an inbound Shipment in Sterling WMS
          ItemAlias ItemAlias source validates if scanned data is a valid Item Alias in Sterling WMS. If found, it returns Item context information like Item id, Unit Of Measure.
          ItemID ItemID source validates if scanned data is a valid Item id in Sterling WMS. It considers items having 'published' status only.
          LocationBarCode LocationBarCode source validates if scanned data is a valid numeric barcode identifier of a location defined in Sterling WMS. It would also return location zone if a valid location is found.
          LocationID LocationID source validates if scanned data is a valid Location identifier defined in Sterling WMS. It would also return location zone if a valid location is found.
          LocationInventory LocationInventory source validates if scanned data is a valid Carton number in Sterling WMS
          NewTote NewTote source creates a new Tote in Sterling WMS with id set as scanned data.
          OutboundShipmentCartonSCM OutboundShipmentCartonSCM source validates if scanned data is a valid Case SCM for an Outbound Shipment in Sterling WMS
          OutboundShipmentPalletSCM OutboundShipmentPalletSCM source validates if scanned data is a valid Pallet SCM for an Outbound Shipment in Sterling WMS
          PalletID PalletID source validates if scanned data is an existing Pallet SCM in Sterling WMS. If this pallet contains only single item then it would return item details like Item Id, unit of measure and quantity.
          PalletNo PalletNo source validates if scanned data is a valid Pallet number for a shipment in Sterling WMS
          PalletSCM PalletSCM source validates if scanned data is a valid Pallet SCM for a shipment in Sterling WMS
          SerialNo SerialNo is functionally similar to SerialTranslator. See SerialTranslator source for more details.
          SerialTranslator SerialTranslator source validates if scanned data is a valid Serial number in Sterling WMS
          Shipment Shipment source validates if scanned data is a valid shipment in Sterling WMS. It returns shipment(s) in following scenarios:
          If scanned data is outbound shipment, it returns the shipment information.
          If scanned data is outbound shipment container SCM, it returns the associated shipment information.
          If scanned data is a batch number, it returns all the shipments included in the batch and the associated wave.
          If scanned data is an inventory LPN it returns all the shipments whose tasks are completed with the LPN.
          If item pick process is used for picking then if scanned data is item id or an inventory LPN the translator first tries to find eligible waves for the item and suggests the shipments from the waves. If no waves are found for the scanned data the translator looks into shipments not included in wave. Only the shipments which can be satisfied with the quantity are suggested. shipments will be suggested in the ascending order of expected shipment date and unplaced quantity.
          ShipmentWithError This source is functionally similar to Shipment source. The only difference is ShipmentWithError would throw an exception in certain cases. e.g. When inventory container doesn't have enough quantity to pack any shipment.
          TrackingNo TrackingNo source validates if scanned data is a valid container tracking number for a shipment in Sterling WMS
          UCC128Code UCC Code 128 is a widely used barcode standard. UCC128Code source validates if scanned data confirms to UCC128 standards.
          UPCCodeWithQtyDefault UPCCodeWithQtyDefault source validates if scanned data is a valid Item UPC Code. If found, it returns item context information like Item id, Unit Of Measure. It also returns default quantity '1'.
          WaveNo WaveNo source validates if scanned data is a valid Wave number in Sterling WMS
          WorkOrder WorkOrder source validates if scanned data is a valid WorkOrder in Sterling WMS
          ZoneID ZoneID source validates if scanned data is a valid Zone id in Sterling WMS.
          External Source External Source provides a way to extend existing source functionality or add new sources. It can be used to implement custom logic which is not part of above sources. The External source translator is implemented using the Sterling Service Definition Framework.


        For a given BarCodetype, the translation algorithm is as given below.
        1. For a given BarCodetype, pick up the translators in the ascending order of the sequence #.
        2. While translation sequence exists for a bar code data type, do until 6.
        3. Check if the sequence points to an externally translated source, if yes, invoke the service pointed by the Flow Key and continue with step 2.
        4. Check if the sequence points to a variable length bar code. If yes, skip this step. Else, ensure that the length of the bar code, matches the length in the set up. If length does not match, go to 2.
        5. Extract the bar code between the start and end position. If application identifier is provided, ensure that the start of the extracted bar code matches the application identifier in the setup. If yes, clip off the application identifier and the rest is the bar code that needs to be validated. If application identifier does not match, go to 2.
        6. Handout the part of the bar code data to the source translator after removing the application identifier from the string between start position and the end position.
        7. Check if the translation is successful, if not continue with step 2.

        RF devices and barcodes immensely help streamline processes in a warehouse by providing better accuracy when recording various transactions in a warehouse as users scanning barcode are less prone to errors in input. Barcodes scanners, attached to RF terminals, act as input devices for data.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None

        Audits: None

        Pre Conditions: None

        Post Conditions: None

        Output Template Support: No

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains the translation results. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
